channel.title: Automatic behavior
channel.description:
Dis be a tred. A thread in which I'll ask you to post about your automatic behavior, both verbal as physical. Things you just keep doing despite being inappropriate or unnecessary, but you do them anyway because they just happen automatically.
Example: The lights in the bathrooms at work are toggled automatically. They detect movement and turn themselves on for a few minutes. But that doesn't stop me from opening the door and trying to find the light switch on the wall before entering (and thus letting it pick up my presence).
Other example: Whenever I'm at a restaurant and I get my food, the waiter says "Enjoy your meal, sir.", to which I always reply "Thanks, you too." This is generally followed by a facepalm on my behalf a few minutes later when I realize I did it again.
Go!
*Edit: what the hell.. I clicked the "New Topic" button in the Ladies Club, but it makes the thread in Massdebating? Could a mod move this please? :<*

item.title: Automatic behavior
item.dc:creator: Zerego
item.description:
Bolteh:

You can get arthritis from cracking your knuckles too often.

Citation needed.
As far as I know, that has never been proven.
It’s closer to being disproven, as a matter of fact :3

Read full topic

item.title: Automatic behavior
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Comrade Tiki:

I have the habit that:
No matter how many true things I share, I feel like I’m lying or omitting something in the name of incomplete disclosure. To almost everybody I feel this way. I have nothing to hide, but I feel like I’m hiding everything.

Lies you’re hiding something from us, I just know it. :hmph:

Read full topic

item.description:
I almost always say/write/type stuff with at least one time “I mean like” in it. I mea-oh crap! Almost did it again.

item.title: Automatic behavior
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
…Because with an insecure Windows machine, you never know if something could’ve been added by a hacker and not updated for you

sersoft:

I do this except I post instead of clicking preview, then I edit 5 times.

That’s the way to go. Except usually I edit five times to look like I’m more on-topic, or being less of a douche. Improved grammar is merely a side-effect.

I have the habit that:
No matter how many true things I share, I feel like I’m lying or omitting something in the name of incomplete disclosure. To almost everybody I feel this way. I have nothing to hide, but I feel like I’m hiding everything.

Read full topic

On my desktop, I always right click, refresh.

Wut. Why?

Read full topic

item.title: Automatic behavior
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
On my desktop, I always right click, refresh. ALWAYS.

Marb:

I’m meticulous about my spelling and punctuation with almost everything I do on the internet. Even in places that frown upon correctness or just don’t care. Even when chatting in games, I’ll spell out every word, capitalize, correct my spelling and punctuate (as best as I can, anyway). FF’s spell-checker is one of my best friends

When posting more than one sentence in a forum, I generally “preview” at least one time… most of the time I’ll change and preview at least 5-10 times before I post.

I do this except I post instead of clicking preview, then I edit 5 times.

Read full topic

item.title: Automatic behavior
item.dc:creator: Elpants
item.description:
When browsing the internet, whenever I navigate to a new page, I always hit my home button to go to my google homepage before going to my bookmarks. Strange habit, I don’t do it 100% of the time because I catch myself sometimes.

Read full topic

item.title: Automatic behavior
item.dc:creator: Door
item.description:
Jokerine:

Hahaha, same here. And I’m supposed to speak English in a formal fashion, with Uni classes and all that… But it’s, like, I-AH DAMNIT

Oh my god I totally like, you know like totally yeah!

I read sentences like that in an American accent.

Read full topic

item.title: Automatic behavior
item.dc:creator: Zerego
item.description:
Wombât:

I always have to check the fridge when I’m in the kitchen. Sometimes I just go there and open it like three times during half an hour, no matter how empty it is and how aware I am of that there isn’t anything to eat in there. I don’t have any eating disorders or anything like that, though. I’m not even fat when I think about it.

This.

Read full topic

item.title: Automatic behavior
item.dc:creator: Marb
item.description:
I’m meticulous about my spelling and punctuation with almost everything I do on the internet. Even in places that frown upon correctness or just don’t care. Even when chatting in games, I’ll spell out every word, capitalize, correct my spelling and punctuate (as best as I can, anyway). FF’s spell-checker is one of my best friends

When posting more than one sentence in a forum, I generally “preview” at least one time… most of the time I’ll change and preview at least 5-10 times before I post.

Another thing I constantly do - when someone tells me a story or I read something in a forum, I have an overwhelming need to share a story or anecdote relative to my own situation.
(I’m going to post this in a quick reply without previewing - I feel kind of annoyed at the thought)

Read full topic
